data.name: Van Eck
data.description:
# Van Eck Sequence

> What's the next term? Don't know  
How fast does it grow? Don't know  
Does every number appear? Don't know

## Implement the Van Ecks sequence.

Consider a sequence that is generated as follows:

1. if an element has not previoiusly appeared in the sequence, the next element in the sequence is 0;

2. if an element has previously appeared in the sequence, the next element in the sequence is the number of steps back in the sequence that it appeared.

```Haskell
The sequence starts: 0, 0, 1, 0, 2, 0, 2, 2, 1, 6...
- The first element is 0. Sequence is now [0]
- Although 0 is the last element, since it has not previously appeared, we add 0 to the sequence. Sequence is now [0,0]
- 0 appeared previously at index 0. That is 1-place from the current element. Sequence is now [0,0,1]
- 1 has not appeared previously, so sequence is now [0,0,1,0]. 
- 0 has appeared previously at index 1. This is 2-places back from current index, so sequence is now [0,0,1,0,2].
- 2 has not appeared prevoiusly. Sequence is now [0,0,1,0,2,0].
- 0 has appeared previously at index 3 (2 places back). Sequence is now [0,0,1,0,2,0,2]
- 2 already appeared 2-places back. [0,0,1,0,2,0,2,2]
- 2 already appeared 1-place back. [0,0,1,0,2,0,2,2,1]
- 1 already appeared 6 places back. [0,0,1,0,2,0,2,2,1,6]
```

Your task is to return the number for the given index of the sequence. For example, the index 4 points to 2

### Assumptions
The sequence starts with zero 
and has then the basic length of 1.


Have fun!

Resources:
https://oeis.org/A181391
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=etMJxB-igrc
